abstract: While Morgan Stanley and Bank of America did not get everything perfect with the LinkedIn I.P.O., they didn’t “scam” the social networking company, as The New York Times’s Joe Nocera suggested in his recent column.
snippet: While Morgan Stanley and Bank of America did not get everything perfect with the LinkedIn I.P.O., they didn’t “scam” the social networking company, as The New York Times’s Joe Nocera suggested in his recent column.
lead_paragraph: 10:16 a.m. | Updated Banker bashing has become a national pastime.

headline.main: Why LinkedIn’s Price May Have Been Right
